title: My Journey Into Reinforcement Learning
short: How I built a DRL model that beats DQN using Deep Transformer Q-Networks for intelligent traffic management.
content:
Deep Reinforcement Learning has always fascinated me. The idea that an agent can learn optimal behavior through trial and error, without explicit programming, is truly remarkable.

In my thesis research, I explored how Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) could be applied to solve real-world traffic congestion problems. The challenge was significant: urban traffic systems are complex, dynamic environments with countless variables.

## The Problem

Traditional traffic management systems rely on fixed rules and schedules. They don't adapt to changing conditions in real-time. This leads to inefficient traffic flow, increased congestion, and wasted time for commuters.

## The Solution

I developed an intelligent traffic management system using Deep Reinforcement Learning. The system uses Deep Q-Network (DQN) and Deep Transformer Q-Network (DTQN) agents to dynamically optimize vehicle speed limits based on real-time traffic conditions.

## Key Findings

The DTQN model consistently outperformed traditional algorithms and the baseline DQN by leveraging temporal data to make more adaptive and efficient routing decisions.

## What I Learned

This project taught me the importance of:
- Understanding the problem domain deeply
- Choosing the right architecture for the task
- Proper evaluation and benchmarking
- Iterative improvement based on results

The journey wasn't easy, but the results were worth it. I'm excited to continue exploring how AI can solve real-world problems.

title: Building My First Full-Stack Application
short: Lessons learned from building Railway eService - a full-stack ticketing system with React and ASP.NET.
content:
Building a full-stack application from scratch is one of the most rewarding experiences for a developer. It's where you see all the pieces come together - frontend, backend, database, and deployment.

## The Project

Railway eService was my first major full-stack project. It's a railway ticketing system that allows users to book tickets, track trains in real-time, and manage their bookings.

## Tech Stack

- Frontend: React with modern hooks and context API
- Backend: ASP.NET Core with C#
- Database: SQL Server
- APIs: RESTful architecture

## Challenges Faced

1. **State Management**: Managing complex state across multiple components
2. **API Integration**: Ensuring smooth communication between frontend and backend
3. **Real-time Updates**: Implementing live train tracking
4. **Authentication**: Secure user authentication and authorization

## Key Learnings

- Always start with a clear architecture
- Test APIs thoroughly before frontend integration
- Use proper error handling and user feedback
- Security should be a priority from day one

This project was a turning point in my development journey. It showed me the importance of understanding both frontend and backend technologies.

title: Competitive Programming: My Path to Improvement
short: How I improved from a beginner to solving 700+ problems across multiple platforms.
content:
Competitive programming has been an integral part of my journey as a software engineer. It's not just about solving problems - it's about thinking algorithmically, optimizing solutions, and pushing your limits.

## Starting Out

I started competitive programming during my first year of university. Initially, it was overwhelming. The problems seemed impossible, and I struggled with even basic algorithms.

## The Turning Point

What changed everything was consistency. I committed to solving at least one problem every day, no matter how busy I was. This simple habit transformed my problem-solving abilities.

## Platforms I Use

- **Codeforces**: Great for algorithmic thinking and contests
- **CodeChef**: Excellent for learning new techniques
- **LeetCode**: Perfect for interview preparation
- **CSES**: Comprehensive problem set

## Key Strategies

1. **Start Easy**: Don't jump to hard problems immediately
2. **Understand, Don't Memorize**: Focus on understanding the underlying concepts
3. **Practice Regularly**: Consistency beats intensity
4. **Participate in Contests**: Real-time pressure improves your skills
5. **Review Solutions**: Learn from others' approaches

## Current Status

- Codeforces: Max Rating 1263 (Pupil)
- CodeChef: Max Rating 1542 (3 Star)
- LeetCode: 120+ problems solved
- Total: 700+ problems across all platforms

## The Impact

Competitive programming has improved my:
- Problem-solving skills
- Algorithm knowledge
- Code optimization abilities
- Time management under pressure

It's a journey that never ends, and I'm excited to keep improving!
